bill.title: House Substitute for SB 124 by Committee on Commerce, Labor and Economic Development - Expanding STAR bonds by adding rural redevelopment projects and major business facilities, prohibiting public officials from employment with a developer, providing for public notice of hearings on city or county websites, posting of certain documents and links on websites, disclosure of names of developer, disclosure of state, federal and local tax incentives within a STAR bond district, changing certain project financing, investment and sales provisions, adding visitor tracking plan requirements and additional feasibility study requirements with oversight by the secretary, requiring approval by the secretary for real estate transfers, requiring district contiguity and extending the sunset date.
bill.description: House Substitute for SB 124 by Committee on Commerce, Labor and Economic Development - Expanding STAR bonds by adding rural redevelopment projects and major business facilities, prohibiting public officials from employment with a developer, providing for public notice of hearings on city or county websites, posting of certain documents and links on websites, disclosure of names of developer, disclosure of state, federal and local tax incentives within a STAR bond district, changing certain project financing, investment and sales provisions, adding visitor tracking plan requirements and additional feasibility study requirements with oversight by the secretary, requiring approval by the secretary for real estate transfers, requiring district contiguity and extending the sunset date.

history.action: Senate Introduced
Senate Referred to Committee on Commerce
Senate Hearing: Tuesday, February 9, 2021, 10:30 AM Room 546-S
Senate Committee Report recommending bill be passed by Committee on Commerce
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Holland
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Holland was rejected  Yea: 12 Nay: 22
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Tyson
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Tyson was rejected
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Baumgardner
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Baumgardner was adopted

Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Fagg
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Fagg was rejected  Yea: 16 Nay: 19
Senate Committee of the Whole - Be passed as amended
Senate Final Action - Passed as amended;  Yea: 24 Nay: 11
House Received and Introduced
House Referred to Committee on Commerce, Labor and Economic Development
House Hearing: Tuesday, March 16, 2021, 1:30 PM Room 346-S
House Committee Report recommending substitute bill be passed by Committee on Commerce, Labor and Economic Development
House Committee of the Whole - Committee Report be adopted recommending substitute bill be passed
House Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Representative Tarwater
House Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Representative Tarwater was adopted
House Committee of the Whole - Be passed as amended
House Final Action - Substitute passed;  Yea: 101 Nay: 23
Senate Concurred with amendments;  Yea: 30 Nay: 9
Senate Enrolled and presented to Governor on Friday, April 9, 2021
Senate Approved by Governor on Thursday, April 15, 2021

votes.desc: Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Holland was rejected - Yea: 12 Nay: 22
